name: 02-Data Description
content:
Data Description

Two main datasets are used:

  1. Customer Invoice Data (Customer_Invoice_data_trunc.csv)
  • Contains transactional-level details including:
  • InvoiceNo (transaction ID)
  • StockCode (product ID)
  • Description (product description)
  • Quantity (units purchased)
  • InvoiceDate (timestamp of transaction)
  • UnitPrice (price per unit)
  • CustomerID (unique customer)
  • Country (customer/store location)
  • Data granularity: Transaction-level, covering multiple stores and customers across time.

2.Parent Product Mapping (Parent_Product_mapping_trunc.csv)

  • Maps StockCodes to parent product categories.
  • Enables grouping of items into higher-level product families for analysis.

Variable Types:

  • Categorical: StockCode, Description, CustomerID, Country, Parent_Product
  • Numerical: Quantity, UnitPrice, TotalAmount (= Quantity × UnitPrice)
  • Temporal: InvoiceDate

Data Preparation

  1. Data Cleaning
  • Handle missing CustomerIDs (may classify them under “Unknown”).
  • Remove negative or zero Quantity/UnitPrice values (returns or errors).
  • Standardize product descriptions and codes.

2.Feature Engineering

  • Calculate basket size per invoice.
  • Derive store-level KPIs: total revenue, average basket value, unique customers, repeat purchase rates.
  • Create product preference indicators using Parent Product mapping.
  • Add temporal features (month, quarter, seasonality trends).

3.Transformation

  • Normalize skewed features (e.g., log transform sales).
  • Encode categorical features (one-hot or frequency encoding).
  • Aggregate transaction-level data to store-level feature vectors for segmentation.
